intro: Ricinoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed habitats. Ricinoides species are known for their rapid growth and ability to thrive in moist environments. They are sometimes considered invasive in certain areas due to their competitive nature.
